page.title: 16BMX & Scouts in Ringland
page.content: {Bicycle Moto Cross}began in 1969 and there is a track in Ringland owned by the 'Norwich Flyers' at the gravel pits. We have a weatherproof surface and lots of different jumps and bends called berms designed to throw you off your bike. We have heats called motos and then final races.Our track is fast and long meant for power riders and we hold open, club, regional and national meetings there.{(Simon Browning). {Scouts}meet every Wednesday evening and each week a different patrol is on duty so their patrol leader breaks the flag. At our meetings we play games and work for badges and awards. At the end of each meeting, a prayer is read and we are dismissed. We also go on a summer camp and two weekend camps in April in Scotch Hill Woods (Roundwood). {(Chris. Brown & Iain Marshall-Clarke)
